Pre-Game Insights: The Shaheens have yet to open their account in the competition and enter this match second-bottom in the Group A standings, having lost both of their opening two games in disappointing fashion.

Babar Azam's side then looked set to bounce back strongly against their arch-rivals India on Sunday after bundling the Men in Blue out for just 119 in 19 overs, but faltered in the chase, losing the game by six runs.
Canada, the lowest-ranked team in the tournament, pulled off one of the greatest wins in their cricketing history last time out as they stunned Ireland by 12 runs last Friday.
